column5: With some species of fish is is simple to identify a male from a female ie. Rainbows...  But how do you determine the sex on say a Pike, or a Walleye (without gutting the fish to find her full of eggs)  I understand some fish are still spawning? Due to the late winter.. and would like to ensure I am releasing the females so they can do their duty...  So what say you?   G
Prolly can just give them a road test. Sex is determined by score...as it were.
If the fish is difficult and stubborn to bring in...its a female. If it comes in easily and doesnt really seem to care much, its a male.    (j/k ladies, but it was just so wide open for a joke...)
Maybe this article will help you?
Hahaha I was thinking the same thing
If the said fish starts to complaining that you are not landing it correctly or for that matter doing anything else right I would say it is a female
If the said fish starts to complaining that you are not landing it correctly or for that matter doing anything else right I would say it is a female
For pike and muskie it is quite simple, generally anything 10lbs or more will be a female over 90% of the time. For any other species it is quite difficult to tell, even to a trained professional.
The fish that have their mouths opening and closing all the time are probably the females.....

If when you boat the fish its starts regurgitating its food-female model fish  If you can see lots of fish but only the occasional one hits, its a guy they wont pass up an easy meal  If a fish eyeballs your bait critically but doesnt hit, its a female.
In the good way, or bad way?????
I think it was Pigeon Fisher who said it best in a similar post a while back.  When you boat the fish.....call it FAT !! If it starts to cry....probably female !!  Meely
